DOCNAME: POPOVICI v. THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Ján Šikuta;Johannes Silvis;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . The Moldovan Government ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE the applicant and a group of CARDINAL other persons were accused of being members of a criminal gang and of having committed numerous offences , including QUANTITY murders and CARDINAL attempted murders . The applicant was arrested and placed in detention on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant of all the charges for lack of evidence and ordered his release from custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in the applicant ’s absence , a panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG examined an appeal lodged by ORG against the judgment of ORG , quashed the judgment , convicted the applicant and sentenced him to life imprisonment .

CARDINAL . The applicant complained to the ORG and , on DATE , the ORG found , inter alia , that his right to a fair trial had been breached on the grounds that ORG had convicted him without making a direct assessment of evidence given by the applicant in person ( see PERSON v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL and QUANTITY , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . As a result of the ORG ’s judgment , the applicant lodged an extraordinary appeal against the judgment of ORG seeking its quashing and a fresh examination of the appeal against the judgment of ORG of DATE . ORG did not object .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the extraordinary appeal lodged by the applicant , quashed both the judgment of DATE and that of ORG of DATE and ordered a fresh examination of the case . ORG also ordered the applicant ’s remand in custody for an undefined period of time without there being a request by ORG .

CARDINAL . After the communication of the case to the ORG , the ORG became aware of the fact that on DATE ORG had examined an extraordinary appeal lodged by the applicant against its judgment of DATE and had upheld it . ORG considered unlawful the quashing in that judgment of the decision of ORG of DATE and the decision to remand the applicant in custody , and reversed those parts of the judgment .
